text:
Pitches Store in Ophir is New Zealand's best ... again RHYS CHAMBERLAIN Last updated 11:44, February 13 2017 Che Baker 
Ophir's Pitches Store owner Colleen Hurd. 
Pitches Store owner Colleen Hurd puts her cafe and restaurant's latest accolade down to team work. 
The Central Otago establishment's reputation was boosted again after it was last week named Silver Fern Farms Best Regional Restaurant in New Zealand for the second year running. 
Head chef Daniel Hill was named runner-up in the Premier Master of Fine Cuisine category. Supplied 
Ophir's Pitches Store head chef Daniel Hill. 
Hurd was "elated" with the win.

"We were pretty chuffed and Dan [Hill] was pretty chuffed. It means a lot." Supplied 
Pitches Store in Ophir. 
Hill's judged dish was Eye of the Mist â€“ an eye fillet, beef cheeks and bone marrow ensemble. 
The win was really good for business, Hurd said. 
"It does a lot for the business and for the locals. supplied Ad Feedback 
"Just since last week we've had people wanting to book in for dinner and wanting to know if Dan's cooking." 
Pitches now had a cliental of about 50 per cent rail trail users and 50 per cent other visitors and locals. 
Being an isolated town with a population of only about 50, Pitches Store needed to be a "destination", Hurd said. 
"One of the things about our place is the food has to be good. [Visitors want] a good bed, a good shower and a good lot of food. Really from the start, that's been the ethos. 
"We all work really hard and it's a team [effort]." 
The "locals are really proud" of what Pitches had achieved, Hurd said. 
The Ophir store is situated in a category 2 New Zealand Historic Places Trust building which Hurd and husband David Hurd renovated to its goldmining-era look after buying it and moving from Auckland in 2006. The Swindon St business, which also has Otago Central Rail Trail accommodation, opened in 2012.
